titlestmt.titleproper: Hull University Archives: Papers of Chris Mullin MP Relating to Miscarriages of Justice
titlestmt.author: Hull University Archives

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid created by export from CALM v9.1.86 Archives Hub EAD2002

did.unittitle: Papers of Chris Mullin MP Relating to Miscarriages of Justice

bioghist.p: Christopher John Mullin was born at Chelmsford in Essex on 12 December 1947.

scopecontent.p: The material in this collection relates to Chris Mullin's involvement in a number of cases relating to the miscarriage of jusice. Each series contains correspondence with Chris Mullin and copies of parliamentary questions and debates.

arrangement.p: U DMU/1 Birmingham Six Case Papers, 1974 - 2002
U DMU/2 Guildford and Woolwich Case Papers, 1977 - 2000
U DMU/3 Carl Bridgewater Case Papers, 1991 - 1997
U DMU/4 Judith Ward Case Papers, 1974 - 1997

accessrestrict.p: Some of the records in this collection contain sensitive personal information.

Those records containing the sensitive personal data information of adults are not available for public inspection for 75 years. Those records containing the sensitive personal data information of children are not available for public inspection for 100 years. This is in accordance with Section 41 of the Freedom of Information Act 2000; uncatalogued papers closed
Audio and video material is not currently available whilst we investigate converting the material into a digital format

custodhist.p: Deposited by Chris Mullin MP, 7 October 2004
Additional material deposited in 2010 has not yet been catalogued.

relatedmaterial.p: Papers of Christopher Price MP also contain material on miscarriages of justice, including Guildford and Birmingham [DMP]
Photographs of members of the Birmingham Six, Judith Ward, 'Free the Bridgewater Four campaign' and Chris Mullin can be found at DCL/1046
See U DCL/732/2 for more press cutting about the Birmingham Bombings. Also DMP/45, 48 and 64

bibliography.bibref: Mullin, Chris, 'Error of Judgement: The Truth about the Birmingham Bombings' (Final Edition: Poolbeg, 1997)

did.unittitle: File. 'Correspondence with Irish Government and Cardinal O'Fiaich'

scopecontent.p: Correspondents include Noel Dorr (ambassador), Peter Barry (minister for foreign affairs), David Andrews and Dick Spring (Labour Party Leader)
'Dail Motion: that Dáil Éireann calls for the release of the Birmingham Six and the Guildford Four'
Bishop Cahal B Daly's homily on the Birmingham Six at Holy Cross Church, Ardoyne, 7 February 1988
Parliamentary debates from the Dáil Éireann, 14 - 15 June 1988
Parliamentary Questions for the Dáil Éireann
Extracts from parliamentary debates from the European Parliament, 11 December 1986
Correspondence with members of the European Parliament

relatedmaterial.p: Part of 'Birmingham Pub Bombings Papers. Box 23', now DMU/1/75-76
